str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Tomorrow. From epi and aurion; occurring on the succeeding day, i.e. to-morrow.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To travel, pursue a way, journey. From a compound of hodos and poreuomai; to be a wayfarer, i.e. Travel.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go up, mount, ascend; of things: I rise, spring up, come up. From ana and the base of basis; to go up.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The roof (of a house), the top of the house. From demo; properly, an edifice, i.e. a roof.
To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
